Message.Title: Alibaba Group will soon be worth $100 Billion
Message.Msg: Dominant Market Share for E-Commerce in China. Amazon and E-Bay total $163 Billion (100B and 63B) in Market Cap. Alibaba Group should easily get to $100 Billion. 23% of $100B is $23 Billion +800m in preferred stock= $23.8B Billion. $17B billion after tax +6 Billion in cash +5 Billion in Yahoo Japan So Yahoo will soon have $28 Billion in cash and no debt but is currently trading at $21 Billion. Yahoo core that is generating $1 Billion in cash flow a year should at a minimum is worth $8 Billion. 36 Billion. Plus the value of the cash to invest in new businesses, buy new businesses raises the value of Yahoo core. So at a minimum the company is worth $31.00 a share. I'm holding until then.

Topic.Title: Alibaba Group will soon be worth $100 Billion

Message.Msg: Alibaba will eventually make YHOO a $30+ stock.

Topic.Title: Alibaba Group will soon be worth $100 Billion

Message.Msg: How can Alibaba Group easily get to $100 Billion when Amazon and E-Bay total $163 Billion considering that Amazon and E-Bay total revenue is $70 billion and Alibaba Group total revenue is $4 billion?

Message.Title: Yahoo buyback will begin when Yahoo gives guidance within the next two weeks
Message.Msg: Yahoo's new CFO and Marissa Mayer did not give guidance at the last earnings meeting. Ken Goldmen, Yahoo's CFO, said they would give guidance in approximately one month form that meeting. My sources tell me once Yahoo releases guidance they will begin buying back $3 billion in Yahoo stock at a very fast pace.

Topic.Title: Yahoo buyback will begin when Yahoo gives guidance within the next two weeks

Message.Msg: Correction: Ken Goldman

Topic.Title: Yahoo buyback will begin when Yahoo gives guidance within the next two weeks

Message.Msg: Sounds like they think the stock will go down after guidance

Topic.Title: Yahoo buyback will begin when Yahoo gives guidance within the next two weeks

Message.Msg: Guidance will be conservative.

Topic.Title: Did Yahoo Begin Their $3 billion Buyback?

Message.Msg: $1 to $2 billion buyback this quarter is likely.

Topic.Title: Yahoo buyback will begin when Yahoo gives guidance within the next two weeks

Message.Msg: They waited to give guidance because of Alibaba. They wanted to get quarter results from Alibaba and their 11/11 results also, imo. Probably will give good guidance and the stock will run up. Remember Alibaba posted 1+ billion in last quarter and $3b in sales on 11/11. The only unknown is what margin Alibaba ran on 11/11. I think the guidance will contain a lot about Alibaba and what they think of its future. Maybe they have secured a buyer for Yahoo Japan or have sold some of their holdings in it also. We will see.. I don't believe much buy back has been going on with so many others interested in buying. I think it would of been very tough for Yahoo to accumulate more than 10 to 20 million shares.... jmho

Topic.Title: Did Yahoo Begin Their $3 billion Buyback?

Message.Msg: Just for most peoples information the most a company can buy in one day is about 3 to 5 percent of what is traded that day. Any more and the stock would spike. Buying back stock is a long and complicated process especially when you are trading a stock that is now in the cross hairs of a lot of big investors. I think the most Yahoo can do daily is about 1 to 1.5 million shares on a good day. So if they were attempting to buy back it would take them over 100 to 150 trading days. This is just how it works. But it is a positive thing that the stock has gone up so well and Yahoo has just begun its venture.

Topic.Title: Did Yahoo Begin Their $3 billion Buyback?

Message.Msg: A $1 to $2 billion buyback in this quarter is possible and likely.

Topic.Title: Did Yahoo Begin Their $3 billion Buyback?

Message.Msg: the difference is in this case Yahoo's core value (Alibaba, COH, and Yahoo Japan) after tax is about 15+ billion. That is a put under this stock at that amount about $15pps. Also, Yahoo is trying to buy back almost 20% of its float which is very, very difficult considering you have to convince institutions to sell their shares because between insiders and institutions they own 80% of the shares. You then have the remaining 20% of which more than half are probably long term holders so that leaves you about 100 million liquid shares to trade. A lot of what people see are day traders entering in the beginning and then leaving at eod turning over the same shares every day.. Anytime you see a stock being talked about a lot and has high volume you see tons of day traders. I personally do not think Yahoo may not be able to buy back that many shares and may decide on giving a one time dividend of $2.75.. Just a thought. This is another reason why guidance was delayed was because of what was happening with some of the tax changes. We will see and good luck to all longs.

Topic.Title: Alibaba Group will soon be worth $100 Billion

Message.Msg: So, Yahoo core that is generating $1 Billion in cash flow a year is worth $8 billion you say. And Alibaba that is also generating $1 Billion in cash flow a year is worth somewhere between $50b and $100b you estimate. You obviously enjoy pulling numbers out of a hat.
